name: PC Apps
section_name: Learn how to use PC apps.

choices.name: Use tutorials for Microsoft Word or LibreOffice Writer.

content.text:
1. Get started with video tutorials for Microsoft Word. Learn basic skills such as writing, editing, formatting text, page layout, etc.
  2. Use the GCFLearnFree online tutorials 1-17 for basic Microsoft Word 2016 skills.
  3. Use the GCFLearnFree online tutorials 18-24 for Microsoft Word 2016 additional skills.
  4. Use the Digital Unite online tutorials for How to Use Microsoft Word. Then follow the "Next" links (lower right) to study each additional topic. Topics include how to start and move around in a document, how to change fonts and sizes, how to copy and paste, etc.
  5. Get started with this tutorial for Office Libre Writer.

    ☆ LibreOffice Tutorial #1

  6. For more information on using Writer, use the LibreOffice Getting Started document.

    ☆ Getting Started with Writer

choices.name: Use tutorials for Microsoft Excel or LibreOffice Calc.

content.text:
1. Get started with video tutorials for Microsoft Excel. Watch the "Workbooks and cells" series to get an intro to Excel, design workbooks, and add text and data to spreadsheets.
  2. Use the GCFLearnFree online tutorials 1-17 for Microsoft Excel to learn basic skills.
  3. Use the GCFLearnFree online tutorials 18-24 to learn additional skills.
  4. Use the Digital Unite online tutorials on How to Use Microsoft Excel. Then follow the "Next" links (lower right) to study each additional topic. Topics include learning about spreadsheets, creating a budget spreadsheet, doing sums and percentages, etc.
  5. Get started with these tutorials for Calc.

    ☆ LibreOffice Calc Tutorials

  6. For more information on using Calc, use the LibreOffice Getting Started document.

    ☆ Getting Started with Calc

choices.name: Use tutorials for Microsoft PowerPoint, LibreOffice Impress, and other graphics programs.

content.text:
1. Get started with video tutorials for Microsoft PowerPoint. Watch the "Presentations and text" series to get an intro to PowerPoint, create presentations, and add and format text.
  2. Explore the GCFLearnFree online tutorials 1-12 to learn basic PowerPoint skills.
  3. Explore the GCFLearnFree online tutorials 13-19 to learn additional PowerPoint skills.
  4. Use the Digital Unite tutorials for How to Use Microsoft PowerPoint. Follow the "Next" links (lower right) to study each additional topic. Topics include how to start and move around in a document, how to change fonts and sizes, how to copy and paste, etc.

  5. Get started with this tutorial for Impress.

    ☆ Create Your First Presentation

  6. For more information on using Impress, use the LibreOffice Getting Started document.

    ☆ Getting Started with Impress
Graphics Programs
  1. Learn about basic graphics tools.

    ☆ RIV: Basic Graphics

  2. Get an overview of other graphics programs.

    ☆ RIV: Graphics Programs

choices.name: Use tutorials for mail programs such as Microsoft Outlook and Windows Live Mail.

content.text:
1. Get started with Microsoft Outlook. Watch the "Sending, receiving, and organizing" series to get an intro to Outlook, send and receive emails, and organize your emails..
  2. Follow this tutorial for using Outlook.

    ☆ Outlook Tutorial

  3. Learn about Windows Live Mail.

    ☆ What Is Windows Live Mail?

  4. Learn how to download Windows Live Mail.

    ☆ What Is Windows Live Mail?

  5. Learn how to use Windows Live Mail.

    ☆ What Is Windows Live Mail?

name: Mac Apps
section_name: Learn how to use Macintosh apps.

choices.name: Get started with Pages for Mac or LibreOffice Writer.

content.text:
1. Learn about using Pages for word processing.

    ☆ Pages

  2. Watch this tutorial video for using Pages on the Mac.

    ☆ Pages Tutorial for Beginners (12:32)



  3. Get help from the Apple site for building Pages documents.
  4. Here are some tips for using Pages.

    ☆ Tips for How to Use Pages for Mac - 2017.

  5. Get started with this tutorial for Writer.

    ☆ LibreOffice Tutorial #1.

  6. For more information on using Writer, use the LibreOffice Getting Started document.

    ☆ Getting Started with Writer.

choices.name: Get started with Numbers for Mac.

content.text:
1. Watch this video for an introduction to Numbers on the Mac.

    ☆ Getting Started with Numbers for Mac (3:52) - 2016



  2. Get help from the Apple site for Numbers spreadsheets.
  3. Here are some tips for using Numbers.

    ☆ 10 Tips for Getting the Most out of Numbers - 2015.

  4. Learn how to import Microsoft Excel spreadsheets into Numbers on the Mac.

    ☆ How to Open Excel Spreadsheets on a Mac.

  5. Get started with this tutorial for LibreOffice Calc.

    ☆ LibreOffice Tutorial #1

  6. For more information on using Calc, use the LibreOffice Getting Started document.

    ☆ Getting Started with Calc

choices.name: Get an introduction to Keynote for Mac or LibreOffice Impress.

content.text:
1. Get started with the Apple tutorial for Keynote.
  2. Watch this video to learn the basics of Keynote.

    ☆ Complete Beginner's Guide to Keynote (34:48)



  3. Learn how to develop skills with Keynote.

    ☆ 20 Fantastic Tutorials for Learning Apple Keynote

  4. Get started with this tutorial for Impress.

    ☆ LibreOffice Tutorial #1

  5. For more information on using Impress, use the LibreOffice Getting Started document.

    ☆ Getting Started with Impress

1. Get help from the Apple site for Mail.
  2. Learn about Setting up Mail for the Mac.
  3. Follow this tutorial for Mac Mail.

    ☆ Mac Mail Tutorial

name: Google Apps
section_name: Learn how to use Google apps.

content.text:
1. Get started with the GSuite Learning Center for Google Docs. Topics including creating and importing documents, editing and formatting text, sharing documents and collaborating, etc.
  2. Get started with Google Docs. Study tutorials 3 for an introduction and 8-15 for learning more skills.
  3. Watch these videos for more help with Google Docs.

    ☆ Tutorial 01: Learn the Basics (4:35) - 2015
    ☆ Google Docs and Sheets Tutorial - 2017 (20:43)


  4. Follow this tutorial for Google Docs.

    ☆ Google Docs Tutorial

1. Get started with the GSuite Learning Center for Google Drive. Topics include uploading and storing files, synching and accessing files, viewing, updating, and organizing files, etc.
  2. Get tips for Google Drive at the
    Google Support Center    .
  3. Follow this Google Drive tutorial from the Google Support Center.

    ☆ Google Drive Help

  4. Get started with Google Drive on the GCFLearnFree site. Study tutorials 2, 4, 5, 6, and 7 for learning more skills.
  5. Watch this video for more help with Google Drive.

    ☆ Google Drive Tutorial (20:02) - 2017

1. Get started with the GSuite Learning Center for Google Sheets. Topics including creating and importing spreadsheets, adding new content, working with rows, columns, and cells, etc.
  2. Get started with Google Sheets. Study tutorials 8-16 to learning more skills.
  3. Watch this video for more help with Google Sheets.

    ☆ Google Sheets Tutorial (30:11) - 2017



  4. Follow this tutorial for Google Sheets.

    ☆ Essential Google Spreadsheet Tutorial

1. Get started with the GSuite Learning Center for Google Slides. Topics including creating and importing slides, adding and customizing content, sharing presentations, etc.
  2. Get started with Google Slides. Study tutorials 3 for an introduction and 8-14 for learning more skills.
  3. Watch this video for more help with Google Slides.

    ☆ Google Slides 2017 Tutorial (13:12)



  4. Here are tips on how to use Google Slides.

    ☆ How to Use Google Slides

1. Get started with the GSuite Learning Center for Gmail. Topics including composing and sending email, replying to email, organizing your inbox, finding emails, etc.
  2. Get started with an Introduction to Gmail. Then follow the "Next" links (lower right) to study each additional topic. Topics include setting up and signing into an account, sending and responding to emails, managing your email, etc.
  3. Get started with an Introduction to Gmail. Then follow the "Next" links (lower right) to study each additional topic. Topics include setting up and signing into an account, sending and responding to emails, managing your email, etc.
  4. If you need typing practice for creating emails, try this tutorial.

    ☆ Typing Tutorial

name: Use social media in genealogy.
section_name: Learn how to use social media.

content.text:
1. Get an introduction to Facebook.

    ☆ What Is Facebook?

  2. Get started using Facebook.

    ☆ Getting Started with Facebook

  3. Learn about Facebook privacy and settings.

    ☆ Understanding Facebook Privacy
    ☆ Adjusting Your Privacy Settings

  4. Learn how to adjust your Facebook account settings.

    ☆ Adjust Your Account Settings

  5. Learn how to share media items on Facebook.

    ☆ Sharing on Facebook

  6. Use the chat and messaging features.

    ☆ Chat and Messages

  7. Learn how to create a Facebook page.

    ☆ Creating a Facebook Page

More Help
  1. Use this Facebook tutorial from Lifewire.

    ☆ How Facebook Works - 2021

  2. Watch this video tutorial.

    ☆ Facebook Basics for Beginners and Seniors (4:39) - 2016



  3. Use the WikiHow Facebook tutorial.

    ☆ How to Use Facebook

1. Get an introduction to Twitter.

    ☆ What Is Twitter?

  2. Create a Twitter account.

    ☆ Creating a Twitter Account

  3. Learn how to tweet.

    ☆ How to Tweet

  4. Learn about Twitter hashtags.

    ☆ What Is a Hashtag?

  5. Follow and connect with others on Twitter.

    ☆ Following and Connecting on Twitter

  6. Customize your profile and privacy settings.

    ☆ Customizing Your Twitter Profile and Privacy Settings

  7. Use this Twitter tutorial from Lifewire.

    ☆ Learn How to Use Twitter in 15 Minutes - 2021

  8. Use the Twitter Help Center for tips.

    ☆ Twitter Help Center

  9. Watch this video tutorial.

    ☆ Twitter Tutorial for Beginners, 2018 (25:04)

1. Get started with the Instagram tutorials on GCFLearnFree.
  2. Use this Instagram tutorial from Lifewire.

    ☆ Instagram Tips and Strategies

  3. Use the WikiHow tutorial.

    ☆ How to Use Instagram

  4. Watch these video tutorials.

    ☆ Instagram Tutorial for Beginners (10:33) - 2017


    ☆ How Does Instagram Work? (36:25) - 2017

name: Use social media in genealogy.
section_name: Use social media to further your family history work.
summary:
There are many social media tools you can use to communicate with others and share your progress and accomplishments. To learn the basics of several social media tools, see Goal 4.

To learn about using social media for family history, watch this video.

hidden.content:
• Google Search
  • Google Newspaper Archives
  • Google Drive
  • Google Docs
  • Google Sheets
  • Google Forms
  • Chrome Extensions

content.text:
Note: Basic Google searches are covered in Project 4: Discover, Goal 4, Choice C.

  1. Watch this series of videos on how to use Google effectively:

    ☆ Part One—10:38 - 2011
    ☆ Part Two—9:13 - 2011
    ☆ Part Three—7:11 - 2011
    ☆ Part Four—6:57 - 2011
    ☆ Part Five—9:28 - 2011
    ☆ Tips and Tricks—9:15

  2. Learn more about using Google tools for your genealogy.

    ☆ BYU: Getting the Rest of the Gold; Google Goldmine for Genealogists—60:44 - 2019  
    • Google Search
    • Google Newspaper Archives
    • Google Drive
    • Google Docs
    • Google Sheets
    • Google Forms
    • Chrome Extensions




  3. Google Photos: See Choice F in Goal 1 of Project 2: Memories for tips about learning and using the Google Photos app for family history.

  4. Google eBooks: Watch this video or read the article on using free Google eBooks for your family history.

    ☆ LLC—Free Google eBooks for Genealogy—3:21 - 2016


    ☆ LT—Google Books: An Untapped Genealogy Resource

Google Earth
  1. Learn about using Google Earth for family history.

    ☆ AR—Flying to the Past With Google Earth - 2013
    ☆ RT—Google for Genealogists: Maps, Satellite, and Earth - 2019

  2. Watch this video for additional ideas.

    ☆ LLC—Ways to Use Google Earth for Genealogy and Family History—61:28 - 2020

hidden.content:
• Youtube has many videos and lessons about a wide range of genealogical topics.
  • Find a speaker or company whose videos are relevant to your interest; then watch the videos and take notes to gather more information on the topics.

content.text:
1. Use these resources to help with using YouTube videos for your family history.

    ☆ FS—Getting Started to YouTube Your Family History - 2014
    ☆ FS—YouTube Your Family History—44:43 - 2012

  2. Learn more about YouTube and genealogy.

    ☆ YouTube and Genealogy: A Visual Library of Learning and Family Bonding - 2019

  3. Channels: Here is a sample list of YouTube channels with helpful videos on family history:
    • American Ancestors
    • Ancestry
    • BYU Family History Library
    • Caroline Pointer
    • DearMYRTLE
    • Devin Ashby
    • FamilySearch
    • Family Tree Magazine
    • Findmypast
    • Genealogy Bank
    • Genealogy Tools (Family Tree Maker)
    • Legacy Family Tree Software
    • Lisa Louise Cooke's Genealogy Gems
    • MyHeritage
    • National Genealogical Society (NGS)
    • RootsMagic TV
    • US National Archives

hidden.content:
• Facebook is a great way to connect with others working on family history.
  • There are many genealogical groups or pages you can join to get more information or collaborate on a specific topic or research goal.

• Facebook groups
  • Reddit community
  • Google groups

content.text:
1. Introduction: Get started using Facebook.

    ☆ Getting Started with Facebook

  2. Read this article for ideas on using Facebook for your family history.

    ☆ FS—Facebook is Family History - 2014

  3. Access these Facebook articles on the FamilySearch Wiki. The first is an overview of using Facebook for genealogy; the second discusses research groups on Facebook.

    ☆ FS—Facebook Genealogy
    ☆ FS—Genealogy Help on Facebook

  4. Access the Ancestry page on Facebook. For an overview of the Ancestry Facebook page features, watch this video.

    ☆ AC—Ancestry Facebook Page—8:00 - 2012



  5. Groups: Learn how to create a Facebook group for genealogy.

    ☆ BYU—Creating a Facebook Group—13:35 - 2014


    ☆ RT—How to Create a Facebook Group as a Genealogist - 2017

  6. Learn how to maintain a Facebook group for genealogy.

    ☆ RT—How to Maintain a Facebook Group as a Genealogist - 2018

  7. Resources: Reach out to your Facebook friends and collaborate with your family history projects and questions.
  8. Use the Genealogy on Facebook file to search for Facebook pages related to family history, or watch this video for ways to find Facebook groups.

    ☆ RT—Crowdsourcing Your Brick Walls, Part 2—13:51 - 2021  
    • Facebook groups
    • Reddit community
    • Google groups

hidden.content: • Twitter can be used to connect with others doing family history and share small stories or facts about ancestors.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Use this Twitter tutorial from Lifewire.

    ☆ Learn How to Use Twitter in 15 Minutes - 2021

  2. Read this article for ideas on using Twitter for your family history.

    ☆ FS—What Your Grandchildren Wish You Would Have Tweeted - 2014

  3. Watch this Ancestry video for ideas on using Twitter in genealogy.

    ☆ AC—Twitter for Genealogy—30:00 - 2014



  4. Benefits: Learn about the benefits of using Twitter with family history.

    ☆ AR—Twitter and Today's Genealogist - 2013

hidden.content:
• The "Pin It" feature on Pinterest is a way that you can file and catalog images and websites that are relevant to your research.
  • You can use Pinterest to create a timeline of an ancestor's life.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Read these articles to learn how to use Pinterest with family history.

    ☆ FS—The Power of Pinterest for Family History - 2014
    ☆ FS—Can You Use Pinterest for Genealogy? - 2012

  2. Learn more about Pinterest and family history in these articles.

    ☆ AC—Using Pinterest for Genealogy - 2014
    ☆ RT—Using Pinterest to Boost Your Genealogy Research - 2019

  3. To learn more about Pinterest, you can use this set of tutorial lessons.

    ☆ Tutorial: Pinterest

  4. Partner Pages: Explore Pinterest pages for Partners:
    • FamilySearch
    • Ancestry
    • MyHeritage
    • Findmypast

  5. Learn how to build an ancestor timeline on Pinterest.

    ☆ BYU—Ancestor Timeline on Pinterest—8:48 - 2014



  6. Learn about the benefits of using Pinterest with family history.

    ☆ AR—Pinning Down Your Family History - 2013
    ☆ FHD—Why You Should Start Using Pinterest for Genealogy Right Now (and How to Do It)

hidden.content:
• Instagram is a website that is centered around sharing photos and videos and can be used for genealogy and information sharing.
  • Hashtags are a way to categorize and label posts, so use those as an organizational system for your images.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Get started with the Instagram tutorials on GCFLearnFree.
  2. Learn how to use Instagram with family history.

    ☆ FS—3 Ways to Use Instagram for Family History - 2019
    ☆ BYU—Instagram—12:50 - 2015



  3. Tips: Here are some additional tips for using Instagram with family history.

    ☆ FS—3 Ways to Use Instagram for Genealogy
    ☆ FS—4 Tips for Using Instagram in Your Family History Research

name: MyHeritage Technology
summary: This Goal helps you download the MyHeritage mobile app and explore MyHeritage on social media. For information on using the mobile app, see the MyHeritage Moblie App Project in The Family History Guide.

choices.name: Learn about the free MyHeritage mobile app.

content.text:
1. Read the download instructions and other FAQs for the mobile app.

    ☆ MH—Family Tree on Mobile

  2. Learn about MyHeritage mobile app features.

    ☆ MH—Mobile App Features

  3. Learn about MyHeritage mobile app settings.

    ☆ MH—Mobile App Settings

  4. Learn about MyHeritage Discoveries on the mobile app.

    ☆ MH—Discoveries on Mobile

  5. Learn about using photos with the MyHeritage mobile app.

    ☆ MH—Photos on Mobile

1. Follow MyHeritage on Facebook.
  2. Follow MyHeritage on Twitter.
